title: Watches That Can Save Your Life | Men's Health
text:
Style watches The 7 Watches That Can Save Your Life A watch doesn’t just make your life easier—it can help you make the most of it By Dan Michel February 13, 2017 Image courtesy of Victorinox 
Two centuries ago, Louis Moinet invented the chronograph to track the movement of the stars. Since then, pilots, divers, racers, explorers, and other workingmen have pushed watch design and functionality. 
Big crowns, light-up numbers, rotating bezels, and waterproof housings are examples of trickle-down tech, says Jack Forster, editor-in-chief of the watch site Hodinkee. 
“It’s about useful features and extreme durability,” he says. 
We’re not taking the term durable lightly, either. These seven watches could actually save your life.
